## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey there! I'm here to help with any questions you may have about Verus. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
I've been trying to create a PBaaS chain, and I'm running into some issues. What's a limitation in the GUI when creating a PBaaS chain with a currency name that is already supported in Verus Desktop?

**AI Assistant:**
I can help you with that. In the GUI, if a currency is already supported in Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.

**User:**
Okay, that makes sense. Before I continue, what's the disclaimer for using this software?

**AI Assistant:**
Good question! This software is experimental and unfinished. Use at your own risk! No warranty for any kind of damage! The software is provided "as is", without warranty of any kind, express or implied, including but not limited to the warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement. In no event shall the authors or copyright holders be liable for any claim, damages, or other liability, whether in an action of contract, tort, or otherwise, arising from, out of, or in connection with the software or the use or other dealings in the software.

**User:**
Got it. Another question I have is, what's a limitation when creating a currency from an ID with a properly encoded i-address as its actual name?

**AI Assistant:**
When an ID has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, you will not be able to make a currency from that ID. This is because using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration.

**User:**
That's good to know. Why is it not recommended to make an ID with an i-address as its name?

**AI Assistant:**
It's not recommended to make an ID with an i-address as its name because it will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (in many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies.
What is a limitation in the GUI when creating a PBaaS chain with a currency name that is already supported in Verus Desktop?

In the GUI, if a currency is already supported in Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.

#### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of: 1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.### DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software.
